About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.
We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.
The Role Responsibilities
We are seeking a talented and motivated System Reliability Engineer to join a high performing Scrum team to roll out a new Common API platform (Olympus). The candidate must be a skilled professional who has E2E software development experience with a desire to work on an Agile, dynamic and flat organisational structure.
The role holder is responsible for leading and setting up DevOps & SRE practises across Wealth and Private Banking to promote a better customer experience.
Expect to be challenged in your adaptability and ability to think outside the box and use creative ideas to solve complex, real world programming challenges.

  • Build & Lead DevOps / SRE team to enhance resiliency and application quality

  • Design and deliver multi-tenant platforms for applications ( APIs / UIs )

  • Should be well versed to setup platform observability based on defined SLO

  • Define the SLI&rsquos for platform & application level to achieve the SLA&rsquos

  • Reduce toil and deliver fully automated platform setup

  • Provide the support for L3 production incident & drive the blameless post-mortem for RCA

  • Promote adoption and rollout of Agile and modern software engineering practices

  • Continues improve platform performance based on SLA/SLO/SLI and toil reduction

  • Implementation of robust, fault tolerant and distributed platform

  • Successful implementation of Agile practices and tools

  • Delivery of multi team projects and co-ordination of interdependencies

  • Delivery of applications that attend business and clients needs following infrastructure as a code principal and CI/CD pipeline

  • Ability to solve complex software development/design issues using clean, coherent code following established coding guidelines


Our Ideal Candidate

  • Experience in delivering low latency and highly available applications. Banking experience is desired.

  • 10 or more years of IT experience with expertise in Enterprise Cloud infrastructure (GCP, AWS or Azure) in a mission critical environment. AWS or Azure certification is highly desired.

  • In-depth Kubernetes, docker / podman experience with strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skills. CKA/CKAD is highly desired

  • Expertise in one of the following programming languages: Java, C, C++, Golang or Javascript, with a focus on Site Reliability Engineering or API development

  • Strong experience building CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Git, Maven, Gradle, Ant, Terraform, Helm, Ansible, Artifactory and Jenkins

  • Monitoring and operations experience using tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, Splunk and ELK stack

  • Good understanding of networking protocols and cybersecurity best practices in cloud environment

  • Experience with Redis or Hazelcast is highly desirable.

  • Experience with API gateway

  • Scrum Master and Product Owner certification would be preferable

  • Preferred AWS / Azure Certification &ndash Cloud practitioner, Solution Architect

  • Preferred CKA/CKAD

  • Architecture certification is desired

  • OpenShift, AWS EKS, Kubernetes and Docker/ Podman

  • Helm, Ansible, Terraform, Vault

  • Test automation and security check automation

  • Monitoring and Alerting &ndash Prometheus, Grafana, pagerduty, Unified Meeting

  • Logging &ndash ELK, Fluentd

  • Cloud AWS / Azure

  • DevOps toolchain experience (Bitbucket, Jenkins, Artifactory, SonarQube, AppScan)

  • Design and delivery of Highly available and scalable solutions

  • Software programming experience preferable Java

  • Build automation tools (Ant, Maven, Gradle)

  • Unix, Shell, Groovy scripting

  • Databases ( RDS &ndash Postgres , Aurora )


Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.
